node.name: Common Commands
node.description: These commands are available on all VTY nodes. They are listed here only once, to unclutter the VTY reference.

param.name: help
param.doc: Description of the interactive help system

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: [PATH]
param.doc: Set file path to store the config, or replace if already exists

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: memory
param.doc: Write configuration to the file (same as write file)

param.name: write
param.doc: Write running configuration to memory, network, or terminal

param.name: exit
param.doc: Exit current mode and down to previous mode

param.name: end
param.doc: End current mode and change to enable mode.

param.name: length
param.doc: Set number of lines on a screen
Number of lines on screen (0 for no pausing)

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: length
param.doc: Set number of lines on a screen

param.name: all
param.doc: Do you want to log all messages?
Only print messages matched by other filters
Bypass filter and print all messages
Don't use color for printing messages
Prefix each log message with current timestamp
Prefix each log message with current timestamp with YYYYMMDDhhmmssnnn
Prefix each log message with category/subsystem name
Prefix each log message with category/subsystem nr in hex ('<000b>')
Prefix each log message with the log level name
Prefix each log message with the source file and line

param.name: basename
param.doc: Prefix each log message with the source file's basename (strip leading paths) and line

param.name: [last]
param.doc: Log source file info at the end of a log line. If omitted, log source file info just before the log text.

param.name: set-log-mask
param.doc: Set the logmask of this logging target

param.name: MASK
param.doc: List of logging categories to log, e.g. 'abc:mno:xyz'. Available log categories depend on the specific application, refer to the 'logging level' command. Optionally add individual log levels like 'abc,1:mno,3:xyz,5', where the level numbers are LOGL_DEBUG=1 LOGL_INFO=3 LOGL_NOTICE=5 LOGL_ERROR=7 LOGL_FATAL=8

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: dgsm
param.doc: Distributed GSM: MS lookup and proxy

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: set-all
param.doc: Once-off set all categories to the given log level. There is no single command to take back these changes -- each category is set to the given level, period.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: force-all
param.doc: Globally force all logging categories to a specific level. This is released by the 'no logging level force-all' command. Note: any 'logging level <category> <level>' commands will have no visible effect after this, until the forced level is released.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: level
param.doc: Set the log level for a specified category

param.name: force-all
param.doc: Release any globally forced log level set with 'logging level force-all <level>'

param.name: logp
param.doc: Print a message on all log outputs; useful for placing markers in test logs

param.name: dgsm
param.doc: Distributed GSM: MS lookup and proxy

param.name: debug
param.doc: Log debug messages and higher levels

param.name: info
param.doc: Log informational messages and higher levels

param.name: notice
param.doc: Log noticeable messages and higher levels

param.name: error
param.doc: Log error messages and higher levels

param.name: .LOGMESSAGE
param.doc: Arbitrary message to log on given category and log level

param.name: vty
param.doc: Show current logging configuration for this vty

param.doc: All contexts, if NULL-context tracking is enabled

param.doc: Display a full talloc memory hierarchy

param.doc: Display a brief talloc memory hierarchy

command.id: subscriber (imsi|msisdn|id|imei) IDENT update aud2g (comp128v1|comp128v2|comp128v3|xor) ki KI

param.name: aud3g
param.doc: Set UMTS authentication data (3G, and 2G with UMTS AKA)

command.id: subscriber (imsi|msisdn|id|imei) IDENT update aud3g milenage k K (op|opc) OP_C [ind-bitlen] [<0-28>]

param.name: aud3g
param.doc: Set UMTS authentication data (3G, and 2G with UMTS AKA)

param.name: OP_C
param.doc: OP or OPC as 32 hexadecimal characters

param.name: imei
param.doc: Set IMEI of the subscriber (normally populated from MSC, no need to set this manually)

param.name: network-access-mode
param.doc: Set Network Access Mode (NAM) of the subscriber

param.name: none
param.doc: Do not allow access to circuit switched or packet switched services

param.name: cs
param.doc: Allow access to circuit switched services only

param.name: ps
param.doc: Allow access to packet switched services only

param.name: cs+ps
param.doc: Allow access to both circuit and packet switched services

param.name: services
param.doc: List configured service addresses as sent to remote mslookup requests

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults
Specifies a HIDDEN password will follow
Specifies a HIDDEN password will follow

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults
Number of lines of VTY (0 means no line control)

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults
Number of lines of VTY (0 means no line control)

param.doc: Host name to send the GSMTAP logging to (UDP port 4729)

param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: local-ip
param.doc: Set the IP address to which we bind locally

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: local-ip
param.doc: Set the IP address to which we bind locally

param.name: remote-ip
param.doc: Set the remote IP address to which we connect

param.name: remote-port
param.doc: Set the remote port to which we connect

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: peer
param.doc: Report global and network peer related groups

param.name: subscriber
param.doc: Report global, peer, and subscriber groups
Send all stats even if they have not changed (i.e. force the flush)every N-th reporting interval. Set to 0 to disable regular flush (default).

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: bind
param.doc: Accept VTY telnet connections on local interface

param.name: bind
param.doc: Set bind address to listen for Control connections

param.name: policy
param.doc: Set the scheduling policy to use for the process

param.name: rr
param.doc: Use the SCHED_RR real-time scheduling algorithm

param.name: cpu-affinity
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on a (group of) thread(s)

param.name: self
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on thread running the VTY

param.name: all
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on all process' threads
Set CPU affinity mask on a thread with specified PID

param.name: THREADNAME
param.doc: Set CPU affinity mask on a thread with specified thread name

param.name: [delay]
param.doc: If set, delay applying the affinity mask now and let the app handle it at a later point

param.name: database
param.doc: Set the path to the HLR database file

param.name: PATH
param.doc: Relative or absolute file system path to the database file (default is 'hlr.db')

param.name: euse
param.doc: Configure a particular External USSD Entity

param.name: NAME
param.doc: Alphanumeric name of the External USSD Entity

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: euse
param.doc: Remove a particular External USSD Entity

param.name: NAME
param.doc: Alphanumeric name of the External USSD Entity

command.id: ussd route prefix PREFIX external EUSE

param.name: EUSE
param.doc: Name of External USSD Handler (IPA CCM ID)

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: default-route
param.doc: Configure default-route for all USSD to unknown destinations

param.name: EUSE
param.doc: Name of External USSD Handler (IPA CCM ID)

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: default-route
param.doc: Remove the default-route for all USSD to unknown destinations

param.name: ncss-guard-timeout
param.doc: Set guard timer for NCSS (call independent SS) session activity
Guard timer value (sec.), or 0 to disable

param.name: store-imei
param.doc: Save the IMEI in the database when receiving Check IMEI requests. Note that an MSC does not necessarily send Check IMEI requests (for OsmoMSC, you may want to set 'check-imei-rqd 1').

param.name: no
param.doc: Do not save the IMEI in the database, when receiving Check IMEI requests.

param.name: subscriber-create-on-demand
param.doc: Make a new record when a subscriber is first seen.
Length of an automatically assigned MSISDN.

param.name: none
param.doc: Do not allow any NAM (Network Access Mode) by default.

param.name: cs
param.doc: Allow access to circuit switched NAM by default.

param.name: ps
param.doc: Allow access to packet switched NAM by default.

param.name: cs+ps
param.doc: Allow access to circuit and packet switched NAM by default.

param.name: no
param.doc: Do not make a new record when a subscriber is first seen.

param.name: A.B.C.D
param.doc: IPv4 Address to bind the GSUP interface to

param.name: ipa-name
param.doc: Set the IPA name of this HLR, for proxying to remote HLRs

param.name: NAME
param.doc: A globally unique name for this HLR. For example: PLMN + redundancy server number: HLR-901-70-0. This name is used for GSUP routing and must be set if multiple HLRs interconnect (e.g. mslookup for Distributed GSM).

param.name: bind
param.doc: Convenience shortcut: enable and configure both server and client for mDNS mslookup

param.name: [IP]
param.doc: multicast IPv4 address like 239.192.23.42 or IPv6 address like ff08::23:42

param.name: domain-suffix
param.doc: mDNS domain suffix (default: mdns.osmocom.org). This is appended and stripped from mDNS packets during encoding/decoding, so we don't collide with top-level domains administrated by IANA

param.name: DOMAIN_SUFFIX
param.doc: mDNS domain suffix (default: mdns.osmocom.org). This is appended and stripped from mDNS packets during encoding/decoding, so we don't collide with top-level domains administrated by IANA

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: mdns
param.doc: Disable both server and client for mDNS mslookup

param.name: server
param.doc: Enable and configure Distributed GSM mslookup server

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: client
param.doc: Enable and configure Distributed GSM mslookup client

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: bind
param.doc: Configure where the mDNS server listens for mslookup requests

param.name: [IP]
param.doc: multicast IPv4 address like 239.192.23.42 or IPv6 address like ff08::23:42

param.name: domain-suffix
param.doc: mDNS domain suffix (default: mdns.osmocom.org). This is appended and stripped from mDNS packets during encoding/decoding, so we don't collide with top-level domains administrated by IANA

param.name: DOMAIN_SUFFIX
param.doc: mDNS domain suffix (default: mdns.osmocom.org). This is appended and stripped from mDNS packets during encoding/decoding, so we don't collide with top-level domains administrated by IANA

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: mdns
param.doc: Disable server for mDNS mslookup (do not answer remote requests)

param.name: service
param.doc: Configure addresses of local services, as sent in replies to remote mslookup requests.

param.name: NAME
param.doc: mslookup service name, e.g. sip.voice or smpp.sms

param.name: IP
param.doc: IPv4 address like 1.2.3.4 or IPv6 address like a:b:c:d::1

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: service
param.doc: Remove one or more service address entries

param.name: NAME
param.doc: mslookup service name, e.g. sip.voice or smpp.sms

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: service
param.doc: Remove one or more service address entries

param.name: NAME
param.doc: mslookup service name, e.g. sip.voice or smpp.sms

param.name: IP
param.doc: IPv4 address like 1.2.3.4 or IPv6 address like a:b:c:d::1

param.name: msc
param.doc: Configure services for individual local MSCs

param.name: ipa-name
param.doc: Identify locally connected MSC by IPA Unit Name

param.name: .IPA_NAME
param.doc: IPA Unit Name of the local MSC to configure

param.name: service
param.doc: Configure addresses of local services, as sent in replies to remote mslookup requests.

param.name: NAME
param.doc: mslookup service name, e.g. sip.voice or smpp.sms

param.name: IP
param.doc: IPv4 address like 1.2.3.4 or IPv6 address like a:b:c:d::1

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: service
param.doc: Remove one or more service address entries

param.name: NAME
param.doc: mslookup service name, e.g. sip.voice or smpp.sms

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: service
param.doc: Remove one or more service address entries

param.name: NAME
param.doc: mslookup service name, e.g. sip.voice or smpp.sms

param.name: IP
param.doc: IPv4 address like 1.2.3.4 or IPv6 address like a:b:c:d::1

param.name: timeout
param.doc: How long should the mslookup client wait for remote responses before evaluating received results

param.name: bind
param.doc: Enable mDNS client, and configure multicast address to send mDNS mslookup requests to

param.name: [IP]
param.doc: multicast IPv4 address like 239.192.23.42 or IPv6 address like ff08::23:42

param.name: domain-suffix
param.doc: mDNS domain suffix (default: mdns.osmocom.org). This is appended and stripped from mDNS packets during encoding/decoding, so we don't collide with top-level domains administrated by IANA

param.name: DOMAIN_SUFFIX
param.doc: mDNS domain suffix (default: mdns.osmocom.org). This is appended and stripped from mDNS packets during encoding/decoding, so we don't collide with top-level domains administrated by IANA

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: mdns
param.doc: Disable mDNS client, do not query remote services by mDNS

param.name: gateway-proxy
param.doc: Configure a fixed IP address to send all GSUP requests for unknown IMSIs to, without invoking a lookup for IMSI

param.name: IP
param.doc: IP address of the remote HLR

param.name: no
param.doc: Negate a command or set its defaults

param.name: gateway-proxy
param.doc: Disable gateway proxy for GSUP with unknown IMSIs
